intro: Nigella arvensis subsp. arvensis, commonly known as the field fennel, is a flowering plant belonging to the Ranunculaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, branched stems and basal leaves that are typically pinnately divided. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in loose, branched clusters. Its fruit is a small, three-lobed capsule that contains several seeds. Nigella arvensis subsp. arvensis is often found in disturbed soils and is native to Europe and parts of Asia.
